item.title: Report E-2024110329
item.description:
Report E-2024110329

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-19T12:23:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-11
  • City: DORAL
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING SCREENING PROCESS OF A PREBUILT UNIT (PBU) ULD AAY11427UPS OFFERED TO UPS AIR CARGO SERVICES IN MIAMI, FLORIDA GOING TO COLOMBIA, WE DISCOVERED TWENTY-THREE BOXES LOADED INSIDE WITH FULLY AND PARTIALLY COVERED LITHIUM BATTERY MARKS. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION, A TOTAL OF NINETY SONY WIRELESS CONTROLLERS WERE FOUND INSIDE THOSE FULLY AND PARTIALLY COVERED PACKAGES. THE UNIT WAS OFFERED TO UPS BY SHIP CARGO CORP ON BEHALF OF ZENDERBOX CARGO INC. DANGEROUS GOODS ARE PROHIBITED IN ALL PREBUILT UNITS. AN INVESTIGATION WITH THE SHIPPER IS ONGOING.

item.title: Report X-2024110542
item.description:
Report X-2024110542

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-13
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package found torn and wet. On further inspection, found a Lead Acid Battery that failed at its body causing leakage of sulfuric acid. Note: The package was repacked by the 333-FTLA-N hub. The battery is a walmart return and appears to have been originally sent in the trash bag, from its original recipient, with a paper return label taped to the bag. 15a. Number in Shipment: 1

During a visual inspection, it was found to possibly contain gasoline. This was discovered by removing the gas cap. The shipment is being held for FAA investigation.

item.description:
Report X-2024110348

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-15T12:23:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-27
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Shipment was discovered leaking during vehicle unloading/sort operations. Inner contents: 70 glass perfume bottles @ 50ml each. 5 bottles were cracked/broken (bottles are labeled Lacoste RCQ). Outer packaging is UN4G/X10/S/22 packaging. Remaining contents were placed in a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the customer.
